section.title: Introduction
section.abstract: A philosophical synthesis from elements of the rational/empiricist and the romantic/existential aspects of western philosophy. Sceptical (anti-dogmatic) and positivistic.

section.title: Logic and Emotion, Rationality and Romanticism
Philosophy as Art
section.abstract: A conception of philosophy in terms of its purpose, methods, form and content, which is closer in some ways to literary art than it is to most other philosophy.

section.title: Existential Expressionism
section.abstract: Existential expressionism is the view that life is the expression of self. Such a life need not be philosophical, but here existential expressionism become a philosophical genre in which philosophical thinking is primary, and the written word is judged by how well it expresses the inner process.
